page.title: 13Farming
page.content: Cheddleton has a thriving farming community, mainly dairy. Recently the E.E.C. quota system has caused concern if the farmers in question have had to reduce their stock. The stop-go method recently by the M. of Agriculture, Fisheries of food, when farmers were ecouraged to sell off milk-yeilding animals and purchase beef, only to be persuaded to go back onto milk production, and now their quota has been reduced. Most farmers in the area use silage and when the weather has been as wet as this summer has, it is the only way to get winter fodder satifactorilly. A few farmers grow oats and barley, mainly for their own use, and a few grow tomatoes. There are two garden centres catering mainly for the domestic market.
